intro: Isotrema serpentarium, commonly known as the serpent's root, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
